title: 820-01521 no backlight after close/open lid
message:
I'm working on a 820-01521 (A1932) which had a liquid damage. I have repaired the board so that the machine is running now. I only have problem with the backlight after closing/opening the lid.

After opening it looks like the display is black. After pressing a Key the picture is coming up without backlight.
If i put it to sleep via the menu and then wake it up again, it behaves normally.

Can you tell me where to continue troubleshooting. If necessary, i can give you detailed information about the damage and the work i have done so far.

title: 820-01521 no backlight after close/open lid
message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

I bet for HAll sensor affected by liquid.
One is placed on the keyboard (left) and other on the audio board (right).
Check SMC_LID_LEFT/RIGHT levels.
Try known good audio flex/board.

title: 820-01521 no backlight after close/open lid
message: the backlight flex is damaged, scrape the protective film and apply jumpers..

title: 820-01521 no backlight after close/open lid
message:
I changed the  Audio board and Flex (known good, working in another A1932).
I also had to changed the keyboard (liquid damaged) to a new one.
And i changed the Flex left with Microfon and Hall (used from another MB). 
Nothing  was changed with this problem.
The microphone does not work either (with both Flex).

Then i measured ...
SMC_LID_LEFT = 1,59V
SMC_LID_RIGHT = 1,21V

SMC_LID_RIGHT had (only) 340Ohm to GND
SMC_LID_LEFT had 350kOhm to GN.
So I had a look to U4850, Pad 13 and 14 looked not so good, 13 was almost gone.
I fixed this and have now 350kOhm on both.

SMC_LID_LEFT = 1,59V
SMC_LID_RIGHT = 0,90V

Then i changed U4802, R4800 and R4801 from Donor - did not help.
I hope it have nothing to do with R4804 and R4805 near T2 or with T2 itself :-( 

Do you have any  idea what to do next?

title: 820-01521 no backlight after close/open lid
message:
SMC_LID_RIGHT isn't good.
Disconnect J6100 and check again.
Both signals should be high, when lid is open.

title: 820-01521 no backlight after close/open lid
message:
J6100 is not connected.
The measured values are from the board out of the machine.

title: 820-01521 no backlight after close/open lid
message:
Trmove R4805 and check voltage at pin 1 of U4802.
If still low, check R4801.
You may also try to change U4802.
T2 is the last suspect...

title: 820-01521 no backlight after close/open lid
message:
removed R4805 - U4802 Pin1 = 0,9V
new R4801 = 0,9V
change U4802 = 0,9V

What do you think? Is it an T2-Problem? What can i do next?

Or would it be an idea, making a bridge from U4802 Pin2 (LID_OPEN_LEFT) to Pin1 (LID_OPEN_RIGHT)?

title: 820-01521 no backlight after close/open lid
message:
Looks like T2 sinks too much current from that line.
You can try forcing the pull-up resistor, nothing to loose.
See what happens with 470K-100K resistor in place of R4801.

title: 820-01521 no backlight after close/open lid
message:
R4801 with 392K = 0,934V
with 100K = 0,959V
Should I go down with the values from R4801? If so, how far? Is that uncritical?

title: 820-01521 no backlight after close/open lid
message:
You've already went down 10x, seems that no reaction.
BTW, is J6100 disconnected?

title: 820-01521 no backlight after close/open lid
message: Yes, there is no flex connected to J6100

title: 820-01521 no backlight after close/open lid
message: Looks like T2 problem then...

title: 820-01521 no backlight after close/open lid
message:
ok, i have no experience with t2 - what would you do?
Reflow or reballing? Or do you think the Chip is damaged?

title: 820-01521 no backlight after close/open lid
message:
The chip is damaged.
Be sure no corrosion around U4802, or J6100.

You can force R4801 to 10K, even 1K...

title: 820-01521 no backlight after close/open lid
message:
with 10k i get 1.173V
i would try to go more down with R4801
which value gives a safe high signal?

Arround U4802 is definitiv no corrosion.
R4805 is still from the board - so J6100 can not affect  - is this right?

title: 820-01521 no backlight after close/open lid
message:
With 1k (R4801) i get 1,514V
Is this enough for a high signal

title: 820-01521 no backlight after close/open lid
message:
1.5V could be good, just test.
Corrosion inside J6100 can affect, if R4805 is soldered on the board.

title: 820-01521 no backlight after close/open lid
message:
Update - I installed the board for test:
mic is working now - think it was disabled because IPD_LID_OPEN was low
closing the lid have now no effect - don't go in sleep mode.

I think the customer can live with this and switch off over the menu before closing.

But could it be an idea to cut the trace to Pin1/U4802 and make a bridge to Pin2/U4802
So the machine would only use LID_OPEN_LEFT for this.

What do you think, could this work?

title: 820-01521 no backlight after close/open lid
message:
Did you resolder R4805?
If not, right hall sensor is not used.

title: 820-01521 no backlight after close/open lid
message: yes I resolderd R4805

title: 820-01521 no backlight after close/open lid
message:
Then SMC_LID_RIGHT shoud go low, when lid is closed.
If not, the corresponding hall sensor is bad.

title: 820-01521 no backlight after close/open lid
message: can you tell me where the hall sensor is? on the audio-board or in the speaker-model.

title: 820-01521 no backlight after close/open lid
message:
On the lid bezel should be placed a magnet which go close to the hall sensor area, when lid is closed.
Find the magnet position with a screwdriver.

title: 820-01521 no backlight after close/open lid
message:
I found it - it's in the speaker case - I broke one to see.
I changed the audio board, the speaker/hall-sensor and the flex to the MLB two times with known good parts.

title: 820-01521 no backlight after close/open lid
message:
"Then SMC_LID_RIGHT shoud go low, when lid is closed."
Checked it?

title: 820-01521 no backlight after close/open lid
message:
Yes, when lid is closed SMC_LID_RIGHT is low (measured at Pin1 of R4805)
when it's opened  SMC_LID_RIGHT is 1,801V.

I also checked SMC_LID_LEFT (measured at Pin1 of R4804)
same values

title: 820-01521 no backlight after close/open lid
message: This confirm a problem with T2 on that signal...

title: 820-01521 no backlight after close/open lid
message: I forgot to ask, IPD_LID_OPEN works too?

title: 820-01521 no backlight after close/open lid
message:
IPD_LID_OPEN is always high :-(
I changed the U4802 two times from Donor. Maybe they was both bad? Or could there be another problem with IPD_LID_OPEN?

title: 820-01521 no backlight after close/open lid
message:
U4802 MUST pull down its output, when both inputs are low.
Check surrounding traces.
Disconnect J6700 and check again.

title: 820-01521 no backlight after close/open lid
message:
Disconnecting J6700 had no effect - still 1.8V (open and closed).
The traces arround U4802 are ok - but i'll have a look again

title: 820-01521 no backlight after close/open lid
message:
Replace U4802 again, just in case.
Be sure to use correct (OR) chip; both inputs must be low, to get output low.

title: 820-01521 no backlight after close/open lid
message:
replaced U4802 again (from Donor 820-00426 U8170)
whatever i measured before when i told you that SMC_LID_RIGHT is low when lid is closed ??!!!
Now i have 1,409V as low-signal (measured at R4801 Pin2) and 1.518V as high-signal.

I can't find the reason for SMC_LID_RIGHT not going low. Could it have to do with the T2-Problem? It's the line we was going down from 1M to 1K with R4801.

title: 820-01521 no backlight after close/open lid
message:
It should go low when right hall sensor is activated.
That happens when the magnet from the lid go close to the sensor.
